info.description: The Network Cloud APIs provide management of the on-premises clusters and their resources, such as, racks, bare metal hosts, virtual machines, workload networks and more.
info.title: NetworkCloud

get.description: Get a list of all available resource provider operations. It contains a URL link to get the next set of results.
get.summary: List resource provider operations.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get a list of bare metal machines in the provided subscription. The API returns 200 OK when the operation is successful.
get.summary: List bare metal machines in the subscription.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get a list of cluster managers in the provided subscription.
get.summary: List cluster managers in the subscription.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get a list of clusters in the provided subscription.
get.summary: List clusters in the subscription.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get a list of additional details related to Hybrid AKS provisioned clusters in the provided subscription. The API returns 200 OK when the operation is successful.
get.summary: List additional details related to Hybrid AKS provisioned clusters in the subscription.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get a list of Hybrid AKS management domains in the provided subscription. The API returns 200 OK when the operation is successful.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get a list of rack SKUs in the provided subscription. The API returns 200 OK when the API is successful.
get.summary: List rack SKUs in the subscription.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get the properties of the provided rack SKU. The API returns 200 OK when the operation is successful.
get.summary: Retrieve the rack SKU.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get a list of racks in the provided subscription. The API returns 200 OK when the operation is successful.
get.summary: List racks in the subscription.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.summary: List virtual machines in the subscription.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get a list of workload networks in the provided subscription.  The API returns 200 OK when the API is successful.
get.summary: List workload networks in the subscription.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get a list of bare metal machines in the provided resource group. The API returns 200 OK when the operation is successful.
get.summary: List bare metal machines in the resource group.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get properties of the provided bare metal machine. The API returns 200 OK when the operation is successful.
get.summary: Retrieve the bare metal machine.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description:
Create a new bare metal machine or update the properties of the existing one. The API returns 200 OK in case of the successful creation or update. 201 Created is returned when the operation is performed asynchronously.
All customer initiated requests will be rejected as the life cycle of this resource is managed by the system.
put.summary: Create or update the bare metal machine.

Azure-AsyncOperation.description: The URL to retrieve the status of the asynchronous operation.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: Delete the provided bare metal machine. The API returns 200 OK when the deletion is successful. 202 Accepted is returned when the operation is performed asynchronously.

Azure-AsyncOperation.description: The URL to retrieve the status of the asynchronous operation.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

patch.description: Patch properties of the provided bare metal machine, or update tags associated with the bare metal machine. Properties and tag updates can be done independently. The API returns 200 OK when the operation is successful. 202 Accepted is returned when the operation is performed asynchronously.

Azure-AsyncOperation.description: The URL to retrieve the status of the asynchronous operation.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Cordon the provided bare metal machine's Kubernetes node. The API returns 202 Accepted as the operation is performed.

Azure-AsyncOperation.description: The URL to retrieve the status of the asynchronous operation.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Power off the provided bare metal machine. The API returns 202 Accepted as the operation is performed asynchronously.
post.summary: Power off the bare metal machine.

Azure-AsyncOperation.description: The URL to retrieve the status of the asynchronous operation.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Reimage the provided bare metal machine. The API returns 202 Accepted as the operation is performed asynchronously.

Azure-AsyncOperation.description: The URL to retrieve the status of the asynchronous operation.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Restart the provided bare metal machine. The API returns 202 Accepted as the operation is performed asynchronously.

Azure-AsyncOperation.description: The URL to retrieve the status of the asynchronous operation.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Run the command or the script on the provided bare metal machine. The API returns 202 Accepted as the operation is performed asynchronously. The URL to storage account with the command execution results and the command exit code can be retrieved from the operation status API once available.
post.summary: Run the command on the bare metal machine.

Azure-AsyncOperation.description: The URL to retrieve the status of the asynchronous operation.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Run the parameterized tcpdump command against the provided bare metal machine. The API returns 202 Accepted as the operation is performed asynchronously. The URL to storage account with the command execution results and the command exit code can be retrieved from the operation status API once available.
post.summary: Run the tcpdump command for the bare metal machine.

Azure-AsyncOperation.description: The URL to retrieve the status of the asynchronous operation.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Start the provided bare metal machine. The API returns 202 Accepted as the operation is performed asynchronously.

Azure-AsyncOperation.description: The URL to retrieve the status of the asynchronous operation.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Uncordon the provided bare metal machine's Kubernetes node. The API returns 202 Accepted as the operation is performed.

Azure-AsyncOperation.description: The URL to retrieve the status of the asynchronous operation.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

Azure-AsyncOperation.description: The URL to retrieve the status of the asynchronous operation.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: Delete the provided cluster manager.The API returns 200 OK when the cluster manager is deleted successfully. 202 Accepted is returned when the operation is performed asynchronously.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

patch.description: Patch properties of the provided cluster manager, or update the tags assigned to the cluster manager. Properties and tag updates can be done independently. The API returns 200 OK when the operation is successful.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: Delete the provided cluster. The API returns 200 OK when the deletion is successful. 202 Accepted is returned when the operation is performed asynchronously.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

patch.description: Patch the properties of the provided cluster, or update the tags associated with the cluster. Properties and tag updates can be done independently. The API returns 200 OK when the update is successful. 202 Accepted is returned when the operation is performed asynchronously.

post.description: Update the version of the provided cluster to one of the available supported versions. The API returns 202 Accepted as the operation is performed asynchronously.

BareMetalMachine.title: BareMetalMachine represents the physical machine in the rack.

extendedLocation.description: The extended location of the cluster associated with the resource.

id.description: Fully qualified resource ID for the resource. Ex - /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{resourceProviderNamespace}/{resourceType}/{resourceName}

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

properties.description: The list of the resource properties.

systemData.description: The Azure system data generated for the resource.

type.description: The type of the resource. E.g. "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines" or "Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts"

BareMetalMachineCordonParameters.title: BareMetalMachineCordonParameters represents the body of the request to evacuate workloads from node on a bare metal machine.

evacuate.description: The indicator of whether to evacuate the node workload when the bare metal machine is cordoned.

BareMetalMachineList.title: BareMetalMachineList represents a list of bare metal machines.

nextLink.description: The link used to get the next page of operations.

value.description: The list of bare metal machines.

BareMetalMachinePatchParameters.title: BareMetalMachinePatchParameters represents the body of the request to patch bare metal machine properties.

properties.description: The list of the resource properties.

tags.description: The Azure resource tags that will replace the existing ones.

BareMetalMachinePatchProperties.title: BareMetalMachinePatchProperties represents the properties of the bare metal machine that can be patched.

bootMacAddress.description: The MAC address of the NIC connected to the PXE network.

machineLocation.description: The name of the location for the bare metal machine.

BareMetalMachinePowerOffParameters.title: BareMetalMachinePowerOffParameters represents the body of the request to power off bare metal machine.

skipShutdown.description: The indicator of whether to skip the graceful OS shutdown and power off the bare metal machine immediately.

BareMetalMachineProperties.title: BareMetalMachineProperties represents the properties of a bare metal machine.

adminStatus.description: The admin status of the bare metal machine.

bmcConnectionString.description: The connection string for the bare metal controller on this bare metal machine.

bootMacAddress.description: The MAC address of a NIC connected to the PXE network.

clusterId.description: The resource ID of the cluster this bare metal machine is associated with.

cordonStatus.description: The cordon status of the bare metal machine.

detailedStatus.description: The more detailed status of the bare metal machine.

detailedStatusMessage.description: The descriptive message about the current detailed status.

machineDetails.description:
The details provided by the customer during the creation of rack manifests
that allows for custom data to be associated with this machine.

machineLocation.description: The user-friendly description of the bare metal machine's location.

machineSkuId.description: The unique internal identifier of the bare metal machine SKU.

powerState.description: The power state derived from the baseboard management controller.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the bare metal machine.

rackId.description: The resource ID of the rack where this bare metal machine resides.

rackSlot.description: The rack slot in which this bare metal machine is located, ordered from the bottom up i.e. the lowest slot is 1.

readyState.description: The indicator of whether the bare metal machine is ready to receive workloads.

serialNumber.description: The serial number of the bare metal machine.

tpmEndorsementKey.description: The thumbprint or SHA of the TPM endorsement key that ensures authenticity of the bare metal machine.

BareMetalMachineRunCommandParameters.title: BareMetalMachineRunCommandParameters represents the body of the request to execute a script on the bare metal machine.

limitTimeSeconds.description:
The maximum time the script is allowed to run.
If the execution time exceeds the maximum, the script will be stopped, any output produced until then will be captured, and the exit code matching a timeout will be returned (252).

script.description: The base64 encoded script to execute on the bare metal machine.

BareMetalMachineTcpdumpParameters.title: BareMetalMachineTcpdumpParameters represents the body of the request to execute tcpdump command on the bare metal machine.

filterCidr.description: The CIDR for filtering the tcpdump to only include the packets matching the IPv4 or IPv6 string either as a source or as a destination.

filterVlanId.description: The VLAN ID for filtering the tcpdump.

interface.description: The interface to use on the bare metal machine. If not provided, all interfaces will be included.

limitPacketCount.description:
The number of packets to capture on the interface. If not supplied, the tcpdump will not limit the number of packets.
The packet capture may end early if the packet limit is reached before the time limit.

limitTimeSeconds.description:
The number of seconds to execute against the interface. If not supplied, the default of 300 seconds (5 minutes) will be used.
If the time limit is reached before a specified packet count limit, the tcpdump will end.

BareMetalMachineUserData.title: BareMetalMachineUserData represents the bare metal machine user data for the rack.

bmcConnectionString.description: The connection string for the bare metal controller on the bare metal machine.

bmcMacAddress.description: The MAC address of the bare metal controller on this machine.

bootMacAddress.description: The MAC address of a network interface card connected to the PXE network.

machineDetails.description: The additional optional details such as serial number, asset tag, etc.

machineName.description:
The user provided name for the bare metal machine created from these user data.
If not provided, a name will be generated programmatically.

rackSlot.description:
The slot in which this physical machine is located, ordered from the bottom up i.e. the lowest slot is 1.
It is positional, so the first machine at the bottom is rackSlot: 1, the second machine up is rackSlot: 2.

serialNumber.description: The serial number of the bare metal machine.

tpmEndorsementKey.description: The thumbprint or SHA of the TPM endorsement key that allows the resource provider to ensure authenticity of the machine.

BgpPeer.title: BgpPeer specifies the IP address and ASN(Autonomous System Number) to peer with Hybrid AKS cluster.

asNumber.description: The ASN(Autonomous System Number) of the BGP Peer.

peerIp.description: The IP address to peer with the Hybrid AKS cluster.

BmcCredentials.title: BmcCredentials represents the credentials for the baseboard management controller device on this bare metal machine.

password.description: The baseboard management controller device server password.

username.description: The baseboard management controller device user name

Cluster.title: Cluster represents the on-premises Network Cloud cluster.

extendedLocation.description: The extended location of the cluster associated with the resource.

id.description: Fully qualified resource ID for the resource. Ex - /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{resourceProviderNamespace}/{resourceType}/{resourceName}

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

properties.description: The list of the resource properties.

systemData.description: The Azure system data generated for the resource.

type.description: The type of the resource. E.g. "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines" or "Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts"

ClusterAvailableUpgradeVersion.title: ClusterAvailableUpgradeVersion represents the various cluster upgrade parameters.

controlImpact.description: The indicator of whether the control plane will be impacted during the upgrade.

expectedDuration.description: The expected duration needed for this upgrade.

impactDescription.description: The impact description including the specific details and release notes.

supportExpiryDate.description: The last date the version of the platform is supported.

targetClusterVersion.description: The target version this cluster will be upgraded to.

workloadImpact.description: The indicator of whether the workload will be impacted during the upgrade.

ClusterAvailableVersion.title: ClusterAvailableVersion represents the cluster version that the cluster manager can be asked to create and manage.

supportExpiryDate.description: The last date the version of the platform is supported.

targetClusterVersion.description: The version of the cluster to be deployed.

ClusterDeployParameters.title: ClusterDeployParameters represents the body of the request to deploy cluster.

rackName.description: The name of the rack (rack-manifest) to use for bootstrapping the deployment. The system will determine which rack to use if this is not provided.

ClusterList.title: ClusterList represents a list of clusters.

nextLink.description: The link used to get the next page of operations.

ClusterManager.title: ClusterManager represents a control-plane to manage one or more on-premises clusters.

id.description: Fully qualified resource ID for the resource. Ex - /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{resourceProviderNamespace}/{resourceType}/{resourceName}

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

properties.description: The list of the resource properties.

systemData.description: The Azure system data generated for the resource.

type.description: The type of the resource. E.g. "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines" or "Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts"

ClusterManagerList.title: ClusterManagerList represents a list of cluster manager objects.

nextLink.description: The link used to get the next page of operations.

ClusterManagerProperties.description: ClusterManagerProperties represents the properties of a cluster manager

analyticsWorkspaceId.description: The resource ID of the Log Analytics workspace that is used for the logs collection.

clusterVersions.description: The list of the cluster versions the manager supports. It is used as input in clusterVersion property of a cluster resource.

fabricControllerId.description: The resource ID of the fabric controller that has one to one mapping with the cluster manager.

managedResourceGroupConfiguration.description: The configuration of the managed resource group associated with the resource.

managerExtendedLocation.description:
The extended location (custom location) that represents the cluster manager's control plane location.
 This extended location is used when creating cluster and rack manifest resources.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the cluster manager.

ClusterPatchParameters.title: ClusterPatchParameters represents the body of the request to patch the cluster properties.

properties.description: The list of the resource properties.

tags.description: The Azure resource tags that will replace the existing ones.

ClusterPatchProperties.title: ClusterPatchProperties represents the properties of the cluster for patching.

clusterLocation.description: The customer-provided location information to identify where the cluster resides.

ClusterProperties.title: ClusterProperties represents the properties of a cluster.

analyticsWorkspaceId.description: The resource ID of the Log Analytics Workspace that will be used for storing relevant logs.

availableUpgradeVersions.description: The list of cluster runtime version upgrades available for this cluster.

clusterExtendedLocation.description:
The extended location (custom location) that represents the cluster's control plane location.
This extended location is used to route the requests of child objects of the cluster that are handled by the platform operator.

clusterLocation.description: The customer-provided location information to identify where the cluster resides.

clusterManagerConnectionStatus.description: The latest connectivity status between cluster manager and the cluster.

clusterManagerId.description: The resource ID of the cluster manager that manages this cluster. This is set by the Cluster Manager when the cluster is created.

clusterType.description: The type of rack configuration for the cluster.

clusterVersion.description: The current runtime version of the cluster.

deploymentState.description: The state of the cluster's deployment.

hybridAksExtendedLocation.description:
The extended location (custom location) that represents the Hybrid AKS control plane location.
This extended location is used when creating provisioned clusters (Hybrid AKS clusters).

managedResourceGroupConfiguration.description: The configuration of the managed resource group associated with the resource.

networkFabricId.description: The resource ID of the network fabric associated with the cluster.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the cluster.

supportExpiryDate.description: The support end date of the runtime version of the cluster.

ClusterUpdateVersionParameters.title: ClusterUpdateVersionParameters represents the body of the request to update cluster version.

targetClusterVersion.description: The version to be applied to the cluster during update.

CniBgpConfig.title: CniBgpConfig denotes the values defined in BGP configuration.

bgpPeers.description: The list of remote BGP peers in the cluster.

clusterAsn.description: The default local ASN(Autonomous System Number) that the Hybrid AKS CNI should use when speaking with BGP peers.

communityAdvertisements.description: The list of prefix community advertisement properties.

serviceExternalIps.description: The CIDR blocks for Kubernetes service external IPs to be advertised over BGP.

serviceLoadBalancerIps.description: The CIDR blocks for Kubernetes load balancers.

CommunityAdvertisement.title: CommunityAdvertisement specifies a prefix and the communities that should be associated with that prefix.

cidr.description: The CIDR for which properties should be advertised.

communities.description: The list of communities to announce with this prefix.

Disk.title: Disk represents the properties of the disk.

capacityGB.description: The maximum amount of storage in GB.

connection.description: The connection type of the rack SKU resource.

type.description: The disk type of rack SKU resource.

EgressEndpoint.title: The connection from a Hybrid AKS cluster to the specified endpoint for a common purpose.

category.description: The descriptive category name of endpoints accessible by the AKS agent node, for example, Azure resource management, API server, etc.

EndpointDependency.title: The definition of an endpoint, including the domain and details.

domainName.description: The domain name of the dependency.

endpointDetails.description: The list of endpoint details. The ports and protocols used when connecting to domain name.

EndpointDetail.title: The IP address-based URL details that define the endpoint dependency.

ipAddress.description: An IP Address that domain name currently resolves to.

port.description: The port the endpoint is connected to.

ExtendedLocation.title: ExtendedLocation represents the Azure custom location where the resource will be created.

name.description: The resource ID of the extended location on which the resource will be created.

type.description: The extended location type, for example, CustomLocation.

HardwareInventory.description: including information acquired from the model/sku information and from the ironic inspector.
HardwareInventory.title: HardwareInventory represents the hardware configuration of this machine as exposed to the customer,

nics.description: The list of network interface cards and associated details for the bare metal machine.

HybridAksClusterList.title: HybridAksClusterList represents a list of Hybrid AKS provisioned clusters.

clusterId.description: The resource ID of the Network Cloud cluster hosting the Hybrid AKS provisioned cluster.

controlPlaneCount.description: The number of VMs requested for the cluster control plane.

hybridAksManagementDomainId.description: The resource ID of the management domain associated with the Hybrid AKS provisioned cluster.

hybridAksProvisionedClusterId.description: The resource ID of the Hybrid AKS provisioned cluster that this additional information is for.

hybridAksVirtualMachineIds.description: The list of resource IDs for the virtual machines that underpin the Hybrid AKS provisioned cluster.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the Hybrid AKS cluster resource.

workerCount.description: The number of VMs requested for the worker nodes.

workloadNetworkIds.description: The list of resource IDs for the workload networks associated with the Hybrid AKS provisioned cluster.

HybridAksManagementDomain.title: HybridAksManagementDomain represents the management domains for Hybrid AKS cluster.

HybridAksManagementDomainList.title: HybridAksManagementDomainList represents a list of Hybrid AKS management domains.

nextLink.description: The link used to get the next page of operations.

value.description: The list of hybrid AKS management domains.

HybridAksManagementDomainProperties.title: HybridAksManagementDomainProperties represents the properties of management domains for Hybrid AKS clusters.

additionalEgressEndpoints.description: The list of egress endpoints that allows for connection from a Hybrid AKS cluster to the specified endpoint for a common purpose.

clusterId.description: The resource ID of the cluster the Hybrid AKS management domain is created for.

cniIpv4Cidr.description: The IPv4 CIDR for the CNI network.

cniIpv6Cidr.description: The IPv6 CIDR for the CNI network.

cniIsolationDomainId.description: The resource ID of the isolation domain associated with the CNI interface.

cniIsolationType.description: This controls how the associated isolation domain for the CNI network is created.

cniVlanId.description: The VLAN ID within the isolation domain above the CNI interface is associated with.

hybridAksClustersAssociatedIds.description: The list of Hybrid AKS cluster ID(s) that are associated with this workload network.

platformCniIpv4Cidr.description: The IPv4 CIDR for the CNI network.

platformCniIpv6Cidr.description: The IPv6 CIDR for the CNI network.

platformIsolationDomainId.description: The resource ID of the isolation domain associated with the platform interface.

platformVlanId.description: The VLAN ID within the isolation domain above the platform interface, which handles outbound connectivity for the AKS cluster.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the Hybrid AKS management domain.

virtualMachinesAssociatedIds.description: The list of Hybrid AKS virtual machines that are associated with this workload network.

HybridAksVirtualMachine.title: HybridAksVirtualMachine represents an on-premises Network Cloud Hybrid AKS virtual machine.

HybridAksVirtualMachineList.title: HybridAksVirtualMachineList represents a list of Hybrid AKS virtual machines.

nextLink.description: The link used to get the next page of operations.

value.description: The list of Hybrid AKS virtual machines.

HybridAksVirtualMachinePowerOffParameter.title: HybridAksVirtualMachinePowerOffParameters represents the body of the request to power off Hybrid AKS virtual machine.

skipShutdown.description: When True, bypasses the OS shutdown and powers the Hybrid AKS virtual machine off immediately.

HybridAksVirtualMachineProperties.title: HybridAksVirtualMachineProperties represents the properties of a Hybrid AKS virtual machine.

bareMetalMachineId.description: The resource ID of the bare metal machine that hosts this VM. This value is supplied by the system after the VM is scheduled and created.

clusterId.description: The resource ID of the cluster the Hybrid AKS virtual machine is created for.

cpuCores.description: The number of CPU cores in the Hybrid AKS virtual machine.

diskSizeGB.description: The root disk size of the Hybrid AKS virtual machine in GB.

hybridAksManagementDomainId.description: The resource ID of the management domain associated with the Hybrid AKS provisioned cluster that uses this VM as a node.

hybridAksProvisionedClusterId.description: The resource ID of the bare metal machine that hosts this VM. This value is supplied by the system after the VM is scheduled and created.

memorySizeGB.description: The memory size of the Hybrid AKS virtual machine in GB.

networkAttachments.description: The list of network attachments to the Hybrid AKS virtual machine.

powerState.description: The power state of the Hybrid AKS virtual machine.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the Hybrid AKS virtual machine.

sshKey.description: The Base64 encoded public ssh key of the user.

vmImage.description: The URL to virtual machine OCI image.

IsolationDomain.title: IsolationDomain represents a pair, containing an isolation domain and a set of VLAN references.

isolationDomainId.description: The resource ID of the isolation domain associated with the cluster's fabric.

vlanIds.description: The list of vlans associated with this isolation domain to associate with this workload network.

MachineSkuProperties.title: MachineSkuProperties represents the properties of the machine SKU.

bootstrapProtocol.description: The type of bootstrap protocol used.

cpuCores.description: The count of CPU cores for this machine.

cpuSockets.description: The count of CPU sockets for this machine.

hardwareVersion.description: The hardware version of the machine.

memoryCapacityGB.description: The maximum amount of memory in GB.

totalThreads.description: The count of SMT and physical core threads for this machine.

MachineSkuSlot.title: MachineSkuSlot represents a single SKU and rack slot associated with the machine.

properties.description: The list of the resource properties.

rackSlot.description: The position in the rack for the machine.

ManagedResourceGroupConfiguration.title: ManagedResourceGroupConfiguration represents the configuration of the resource group managed by Azure.

location.description: The location of the managed resource group. If not specified, the location of the parent resource is chosen.

name.description: The name for the managed resource group. If not specified, the unique name is automatically generated.

NetworkAttachment.title: NetworkAttachment represents the single network attachment.

ipAllocationMethod.description: The IP allocation mechanism for the virtual machine.

ipv4Address.description:
The IPv4 address of the virtual machine.

This field is used only if the associated Workload network has a IPAllocationType of IPv4 or Dual-Stack.

If IPAllocationMethod is:
Static - this field must contain a user specified IPv4 address from within the subnet specified in the WorkloadNetwork.
Dynamic - this field is read-only, but will be populated with an address from within the subnet specified in the WorkloadNetwork.
Disabled - this field will be empty.

ipv6Address.description:
The IPv6 address of the virtual machine.

This field is used only if the associated WorkloadNetwork has a IPAllocationType of IPv6 or Dual-Stack.

If IPAllocationMethod is:
Static - this field must contain an IPv6 address range from within the range specified in the WorkloadNetwork.
Dynamic - this field is read-only, but will be populated with an range from within the subnet specified in the WorkloadNetwork.
Disabled - this field will be empty.

macAddress.description: The MAC address of the interface for the virtual machine that corresponds to this network attachment.

workloadNetworkId.description: The resource ID of the workload network attached to the VM.

NetworkInterface.title: NetworkInterface represents properties of the network interface.

address.description: The partial address of Peripheral Component Interconnect (PCI).

deviceConnectionType.description: The connection type of the device.

model.description: The model name of the device.

physicalSlot.description: The physical slot for this device.

portCount.description: The number of ports on the device.

portSpeed.description: The maximum amount of data in GB that the line card transmits through a port at any given second.

vendor.description: The vendor name of the device.

Nic.title: Nic represents the network interface card details.

macAddress.description: The MAC address associated with this NIC.

PlacementHint.title: PlacementHint represents a single scheduling hint of virtual machine.

key.description: The key for the virtual machine placement hint.

value.description: The value for the virtual machine placement hint.

rackLocation.description: The free-form customer description of this rack location. For example, "Datacenter, Floor 3, Aisle 9, Rack 2".

RackManifestProperties.title: RackManifestProperties represents the properties of the rack manifest.

baremetalMachineUserData.description: The unordered list of bare metal machine objects in the rack.

clusterId.description: The resource ID of the cluster to which the rack is associated.

clusterManagerId.description:
The resource ID of the cluster manager that manages this rack manifest.
This is set by the cluster manager when the rack manifest is created.

networkRackId.description: The resource ID of the associated network rack resource.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the rack manifest.

rackId.description:
The resource ID of the rack that was realized by the deployment of this rack manifest.
Once assigned, this rack manifest can no longer be used in a future deployment or update operations.

rackLocation.description: The free-form description of the rack location. For example, "Datacenter, Floor 3, Aisle 9, Rack 2".

rackSerialNumber.description: The globally unique identifier for the rack.

rackSkuId.description: The resource ID of the SKU for the rack being added.

properties.description: The list of the resource properties.

tags.description: The Azure resource tags that will replace the existing ones.

RackProperties.title: RackProperties represents the properties of the rack.

clusterId.description: The resource ID of the cluster the rack is created for. This value is set when the rack is created by the cluster.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the rack resource.

rackLocation.description: The free-form description of the rack location. (e.g. “DTN Datacenter, Floor 3, Isle 9, Rack 2B”)

rackManifestId.description: The resource ID of the rack manifest used to deploy the rack.

rackSerialNumber.description: The globally unique identifier for the rack.

RackSkuProperties.title: RackSkuProperties represents the properties of compute-related hardware for a rack. This supports both aggregator and compute racks.

computeMachines.description: The list of machine SKUs and associated rack slot for the compute-dedicated machines in this rack model.

controllerMachines.description: The list of machine SKUs and associated rack slot for the control-plane dedicated machines in this rack model.

description.description: The free-form text describing the rack.

maxClusterSlots.description: The maximum number of compute racks supported by an aggregator rack. 0 if this is a compute rack or a rack for a single rack cluster(rackType="Single").

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the rack SKU resource.

storageAppliances.description: The list of appliance SKUs and associated rack slot for the storage appliance(s) in this rack model.

supportedRackSkuIds.description: The list of supported SKUs if the rack is an aggregator.

rackLocation.description: The free-form description of the rack location. (e.g. “DTN Datacenter, Floor 3, Isle 9, Rack 2B”)

bareMetalMachineId.description: The resource ID of the bare metal machine the virtual machine has landed to.

diskSizeGB.description: The root disk size of the virtual machine in GB.

placementHints.description: The scheduling hints for the virtual machine.

WorkloadNetwork.title: WorkloadNetwork represents the on-premises workload network.

extendedLocation.description: The extended location of the cluster associated with the resource.

id.description: Fully qualified resource ID for the resource. Ex - /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{resourceProviderNamespace}/{resourceType}/{resourceName}

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

properties.description: The list of the resource properties.

systemData.description: The Azure system data generated for the resource.

type.description: The type of the resource. E.g. "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines" or "Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts"

WorkloadNetworkList.title: WorkloadNetworkList represents a list of the workload networks.

nextLink.description: The link used to get the next page of operations.

WorkloadNetworkProperties.title: WorkloadNetworkProperties represents properties of the workload network.

clusterId.description: The resource ID of the Network Cloud cluster this workload network is associated with.

hybridAksClustersAssociatedIds.description: The list of Hybrid AKS cluster ID(s) that are associated with this workload network.

hybridAksIpamEnabled.description: The indicator of whether to enable IP Address Management(IPAM) allocation on this network attachment definition. By default, IPAM is enabled.

hybridAksPluginType.description: The network plugin type for Hybrid AKS, defaults to "HostDevice".

interfaceName.description: The interface related to the workload network.

ipAllocationType.description: The type of the IP address allocation, defaulted to "DualStack".

ipv4ConnectedSubnetIndex.description:
The index of IPv4AddressPrefix list to be used for this workload network.
Given the isolation domain can have multiple IPv4 prefixes assigned to it, the parameter defines the prefix this workload network is associated with. The index value is zero-based, with the first entry being an index value of 0.

ipv6ConnectedSubnetIndex.description:
The index of the IPv6RangePrefix list to be used for this workload network.
Given the isolation domain can have multiple IPv6 ranges assigned to it, the parameter defines the range this workload network is associated with. The index value is zero-based, with the first entry being an index value of 0.

isolationDomains.description: The list of isolation domain(s) associated with this workload network.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the workload network.

trunkIsolationDomains.description: The parameter indicating whether the isolation domains should be trunked. If more than one isolation domain is supplied, and this value is set to "False", only the first isolation domain will be utilized as an access VLAN to the interface.

virtualMachinesAssociatedIds.description: The list of virtual machine ID(s), excluding any Hybrid AKS virtual machines, that are currently using this workload network.
